intro: Vlokia montana, commonly known as the mountain vlokia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its blooming period occurs during the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained soil and full sun.
